weka.distributed

Class WekaClassifierEvaluationMapTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.distributed.WekaClassifierEvaluationMapTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WekaClassifierEvaluationMapTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Map task for evaluating a trained classifier. Uses Instances.train/testCV() methods for extracting folds for batch trained classifiers or modulus operation for incrementally trained classifiers.
    Version:
    $Revision: 10648 $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setFoldNumber

        public void setFoldNumber(int fn)
        Set the fold number to evaluate on. -1 indicates that all the data should be used for evaluation
        Parameters:
        fn - the fold number to evaluate on or -1 to evaluate on all the data

      • setBatchTrainedIncremental

        public void setBatchTrainedIncremental(boolean b)
        Set whether the classifier is an incremental one that has been batch trained
        Parameters:
        b - true if the classifier is incremental and it has been batch trained.

      • getBatchTrainedIncremental

        public boolean getBatchTrainedIncremental()
        Get whether the classifier is an incremental one that has been batch trained
        Returns:
        true if the classifier is incremental and it has been batch trained.

      • setup

        public void setup(Instances trainingHeader,
         double[] priors,
         double count,
         long seed,
         double predFrac)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Setup the task.
        Parameters:
        trainingHeader - the header of the training data used to create the classifier to be evaluated
        priors - priors for the class (frequency counts for the values of a nominal class or sum of target for a numeric class)
        count - the total number of class values seen (with respect to the priors)
        seed - the random seed to use for shuffling the data in the batch case
        predFrac - the fraction of the total number of predictions to retain for computing AUC/AUPRC
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs

      • processInstance

        public void processInstance(Instance inst)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Process an instance for evaluation
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance to process
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs

      • finalizeTask

        public void finalizeTask()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Finalize this task. This is where the actual evaluation occurs in the batch case - the order of the data gets randomized (and stratified if class is nominal) and the test fold extracted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a problem occurs

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
